website_summaries.verdict: A mid-rated U-lock and cable that provides strong security against bolt cutters and all but the most determined thieves.
pros: Lock’s tumblers work smoothly, allowing for fast locking and unlocking
U-lock plus cable secure frame and wheels easily
Resists bolt cutters and non-power tools
cons: Occasional complaints about customer service and the sturdiness of the mounting bracket

customer_reviews.title: Move to the next lock.
customer_reviews.text: Have to agree with others here, my bike was just stolen at my apartment bike cage. Seriously so disappointing, had both the rope AND u-lock attached to the bike, and mine was the only one stolen. I wish I spent money on one of the locks that alarms and everything... $1200 down the drain. Thanks Kryptonite
customer_reviews.author: St.Libertine

customer_reviews.title: I strongly recommend purchasing either 1) a different lock all together
customer_reviews.text: I'm hoping this product was not an authentic kryptonite lock. After a little more than a year of use the lock became very difficult to release, I always had to wiggle the key back and forth patiently waiting for it to somehow click into position and unlock. After putting up with it for too long it has become permanently locked and will not release - I can even see the internal mechanism has skewed itself so it doesn't line up with the key-guide, and now I need to a figure out a way to remove it from my bike. I strongly recommend purchasing either 1) a different lock all together, or 2) a guaranteed Kryptonite product from an in-store location.
customer_reviews.author: ScholarlyBeard

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: The lock seems to work as promised and it seems sturdy. However, Kryptonite's customer service is an issue. After purchasing this lock, I registered online with Kryptonite and also requested the additional set of keys (the packaging clearly states that an additional set can be requested and they are free). I never received the additional keys. Since there is no apparent phone number for customer service, I submitted my request/question 20 days ago. NO Response or follow up. Update: I did get a response from the company regarding the extra set of keys and I received the keys within the week - almost 18 months after my initial request but at least I finally received them.
customer_reviews.author: Ohiotwins

customer_reviews.title: Product worked great for a couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for a couple of weeks. Now it will not lock anymore. I can turn the key without the U bar attached, but when the U bar is attached the key wont turn over. This is a faulty prodcut and I cannot return it any longer. Buyers beware, look elsewhere...
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Decent lock, but understand it's limitations.
customer_reviews.text: CAUTION: This bicycle lock can easily be defeated using bolt cutters for the primary lock, and wire cutters for the tire cable. Be smart when locking your bike up. Keep the lock as low as possible on the frame to force the thief down low. It is harder to gain leverage on bolt cutters in this position. Before buying this lock, understand what this is intended for, and not intended for by doing a little online research. There are a few good videos on YouTube to watch that show how easy almost any bike lock is to defeat.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: When using the bike lock I feel like the bike is very secure and I have had ...
customer_reviews.text: When using the bike lock I feel like the bike is very secure and I have had no issues using. The added 4ft cable works great when I want further security or if the pole I am attaching the bike to doesn't fit. The only downside is when I'm biking where to put the lock, the attachment to secure the lock to the bike when riding did not fit on my bike properly and would jostle around. However, I do throw the lock into my backpack when riding and I have had no problems. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: To be honest there isn't much to review here. I live in a somewgat okay part of town . Still think it's good to have some security though. This lock is protecting a Razor EcoSmart Metro. A 350 dollar scooter. It hasn't been stolen... Hah! I don't dare leave the scooter outside alone for more than 10 minutes. I have seen people break locks before. This thing is just like a... "Come back when you are ready..." Kinda thing. The lock is a little iffy at times, not taking the key, not turning when the key is in, stuff like that... It works though. And it looks mean. I guess I can't complain! It works!
customer_reviews.author: TailsFurse

customer_reviews.title: Has kept my bike safe in Chicago
customer_reviews.text: Lock is long enough to capture my frame and back tire on a thick chicago train station bike rack. I loop the cable through my front tire and put it through the lock, lock it and go on my way. Been using it about 2 years now and my cute bike is always waiting for me. I suggest watching the Kyrptonight videos to learn correct way to lock your bike - made things easy for me. I was going to buy a used set, but price new was the same, maybe price came down since they came out?? Anyway, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoMom

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend choosing a different lock if you care about your ...
customer_reviews.text: My bike was recently stolen in San Francisco while locked up with this piece of junk. No power tools required -- the thief was able to pry it open with a crowbar. I highly recommend choosing a different lock if you care about your bike at all.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Davidge

customer_reviews.title: Stolen Bike in Los Angeles, bolt cutters
customer_reviews.text: It looks moderately sturdy but someone stole my bike from the campus of Cal State-Northridge and it looks like they used bolt cutters. Most of the other bikes were still there the next day so I'm guessing thieves knew this is an easy lock to break. I'd go for something much, much sturdier next time, not this uselessly expensive lock.
customer_reviews.author: Shobhit

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind in Low-Crime Area Keeping the Amateur Bike Thief at Bay
customer_reviews.text: Quality bike lock with a very thick cable. I don't live in NYC nor do I live in a place where there is a high theft rate for bikes. I do use this lock to secure my bike at the train station and have peace of mind qhen using this product over a cheaper basic cable lock like the Bell I used to use. The attachment clamp fit well on the seat post of my Sixthreezero In The Barrel and keeps the lock out of the way and conveniently located without ruining the look of the bike.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy

customer_reviews.title: unless you are willing to carry this lock in your backpack (which might not be a good idea), do not buy this one
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this one if you are thinking of mounting the lock using the mount bracket. The mount bracket can't even hold the lock. There is a very thin small rectangular plastic part that supposedly holds the lock still to the mounting bracket. But this is too small and weak. I wonder if the manufacturers even rode a bike with the lock mounted. Again, unless you are willing to carry this lock in your backpack (which might not be a good idea), do not buy this one. I hope people who are looking for decent lock with mounting bracket should get useful information from my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great lock but a few times lately it would NOT unlock; it's about 5 years old
customer_reviews.text: Great lock but a few times lately it would NOT unlock; it's about 5 years old. Recently went into a panic when it took about FIVE minutes of twiddling the key to get the thing to unlock. Had no problems for nearly five years and now it is flaky. Was on a trip and could NOT get the lock to UNLOCK! Would have had to LEAVE MY BIKE had it FINALLY, after about FIVE minutes of twiddling the key, unlocked! Use the lock only about two times a week.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Great lock.  Will provide sufficient protection against thieves.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike lock. I have been using this lock to commute to and from work for several years now. This best feature is that you are able to attach your u-lock to your bike’s frame rather than having to put it into your bag or dangle it from your handle bars. Last year someone did try to saw through my u-lock. They actually came pretty close but for some reason they did not finish. However they were able to cut through my cable and steal my front tire. I would recommend this lock, as I have bought this lock a 2nd time in order to replace the one that was sawed into.
customer_reviews.author: danatural

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two, one for each of our two bikes. Go to Kryptonite website and use their guide to determine what you want for your environment. I bought these to secure our two bikes when they are on the back of our towed car behind our motor home and to secure them at the campsite. Of course like the old saying goes: "Locks keep honest people, honest." We don't have very expensive bikes but a little security beats having to replace them or someone messing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G.

customer_reviews.title: Good for low-theft areas
customer_reviews.text: I use this to secure my bike within a secured parking structure. For basic theft deterrence it works fine and the cable is long enough to keep your frame and both wheels secure. I would NOT recommend this lock for any outdoor public areas where bike thefts are common. It's not a very strong lock. One side of the bar simply slides into the locking bracket. It would probably take a determined thief seconds to bypass this lock. For my every day commuter, I use a Kryptonite NY Standard which is much more robust that this lock. I've also got an OnGuard chain lock (which weights about 25lbs) for even stronger security.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lafond

customer_reviews.title: Saved a bike from thieves
customer_reviews.text: My sister's first week at college, someone attempted to cut through this lock to steal her bike. Needless to say, this lock did it's job and saved her bicycle. 2 other bikes on the rack had cut locks and were stolen. Because of her satisfaction, I bought this for myself. When I had the mount adjusted properly on my bicycle, I never noticed it while I was riding. It does take a little longer to set up than my fiancé's combination cable lock, but the safety factor makes it worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: The mount sucks
customer_reviews.text: I heard this was the best lock to get after tons of researching and asking around. I still have my bike so I’m sure the locking does what it needs to do but the mount you get to attach the lock to your bike sucks. The lock gets jammed in it quite often so it’s hard to get in and out. It fits around your back tire, bike frame, and bike rack when locking so that’s great as long as the bike rack isn’t too thick. It also isn’t too heavy so you can travel with it easy if it’s bit mounted to your bike. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, though the mounting system is lacking.
customer_reviews.text: I like it in terms of sturdiness, but the clamp provided with it is pretty much useless as it doesn't fit in the clamp, on my bicycle at all. The lock is just too large, and it clamps onto the clamp in such a way that doesn't spatially make much sense. I have to toss it in my backpack every time I bike to class. That being said, it's not a huge deal to me as I dedicate one of my backpack pockets to the lock, so it doesn't mess up my notes or anything. Still, would be nice to actually attach the lock to my bike while biking, since it's designed to do that and all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Secure, heavy lock set.
customer_reviews.text: The bike lock set most highly recommended by the experts. Like considering any good lock, you have to decide whether it makes sense to spend hundreds of dollars to buy the lightest bike possible and then needing to carry a very heavy lock to protect your investment. I feel secure with this U-lock on my bike frame and the cable looped through the front wheel and frame and locked into the U-lock. I have used this to lock my bike and by wife's bike together, locking them to a bike rack. It works, but things get pretty tight.
customer_reviews.author: JoeInTampa

customer_reviews.title: good rated lock for running around town
customer_reviews.text: good rated lock for running around town, would get something better rated for overnight or in especially bad areas. the cable is great for chaining bikes together so not everyone has to bring a lock to be secure. gives me piece of mind. would give five stars but i don't like the bracket that fastens to your frame to hold the lock when riding. the bracket is too stiff and the lock does not easily slide in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Chagolla

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy but strong
customer_reviews.text: I really like the separate cable, it helps secure the back wheel or if I'm somewhere without a good bike rack, I can pass it around a tree or streetlight while the u-lock gets the front wheel. This sucker is HEAVY, and like all u-locks, a little awkward. After a few days of messing with it, I got a light cable lock for taking to work (where I have bike parking behind a secure gate), and I only take this one when I'm going on an errand or meetup out on the town. I don't use the frame bracket, because I have a basket and I just stick it in there.
customer_reviews.author: SBPTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Balanced option for most bike riders
customer_reviews.text: I think this is an excellent U-lock choice for most users, particularly in suburban settings or places other than a concentrated city where a bike thief is likely to target. In a major city, you probably need something with either a thicker shaft diameter or a chain solution. But, for the price, it's well-built and pretty easy to use. THis model even comes with a cable for additional security or maybe to loop in a trailer or second bike in areas where you are less worried about theft (the braided cables are relatively easy to defeat with cutters).
customer_reviews.author: StormJH1Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I picked up a lemon
customer_reviews.text: First let me say, I've had this lock for over a year and my bike hasn't been stolen. So the protection of this lock is undeniable, especially living in Chicago. The reason I'm giving this lock 2 stars is because from about a week after purchasing it, and ever since, the lock mechanism has become increasingly difficult to open. To the point now where I look like I'm attempting to steal my own bike before the lock finally opens. It's frustrating considering this company is a lock manufacturer, and now it won't open at all and I can't use the bag it's attached to.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Holy bike locks Bat Man!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HUGE, heavy and built to last! It is very heavy so it will definitely weigh you down! I use it for securing my bike to the bike rack on my car. I would never go riding and bring this with me to secure my bike. It's just way too big, bulky, and heavy. The key to lock and unlock it is great! Definitely a great way to deter bike theft.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cole

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it 0 stars I would.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to be spending 30 minutes fiddling with the locking mechanism trying to close or open the lock, then this is definitely the product for you. Do you enjoy keys that sometimes work, sometimes don't? Do you want to try opening the lock a million different ways just to have different results each time, and hours of frustration? Do you want a lock that will break after a week of use? If the answer is yes to any one of these questions or all three, then I would highly recommend this lock for you.
customer_reviews.author: A Consumer

customer_reviews.title: It's a good value for a fair lock
customer_reviews.text: It's ok and does what it's supposed to do. Plus, at $30 it's a great value. It's VERY big/LONG and clunky, heavy (nearly 3 lbs) and in the way no matter where you place it. The mounting piece is pretty useless and I don't suspect I'll get much life out of it. That being said, it's a solid product line as a whole and it's perfectly fine for quick stops and areas you can keep an eye on it, but it doesn't inspire much more confidence than that.
customer_reviews.author: The Burro

customer_reviews.title: the durable rope like feature allows you to connect both wheels and the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the gold standard for bicycle locks. Surprisingly light, the durable rope like feature allows you to connect both wheels and the frame together. After having a few bikes stolen on the streets of new york, I resorted to double locking it. This contraption fulfills that same function in a more compact, lighter and streamlined design. It provides enough thief discouragement to alleviate any concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Adam J. Sacks

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-range lock
customer_reviews.text: This product lives up to the Kryptonite name. Big enough to lock two bikes to a post (I ride with my wife). It has an additional cable to ensure your after market wheels aren't stolen as well. The frame bracket mount is much higher quality then in the past. I owned a Kryptonite U-lock when I was young. The bracket was loose and allowed the lock to flail around. This one however is sturdy and won't move around on its own. Overall, I give this lock a 5-star rating!
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Rahimian

customer_reviews.title: Good solid lock
customer_reviews.text: So far the lock has been easy to use and my bike hasn't been stolen. I don't leave my bike out for long periods so I cant give you an honest review if its deterred theft in any way. I can say that the clamp holster thing this ulock comes with is solid. I ride a mountain bike and jump on and off curves. So my ride is bumpier than most commutes i think. I feel confident my ulock will not fall off in the middle of an intersection during rush hour.
customer_reviews.author: Humberto

customer_reviews.title: Great Security at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Your really can't go wrong with this Kryptonite set. The U-lock is large and easy to use, providing adequately high security for most settings. The added cable provides that little more deterrence to convince any would-be bike thieves that this one is not worth bothering with. As a family, we love the added benefit that it allows us to lock all four of our bikes together into an immovable mass.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bilotta

customer_reviews.title: Tough Lock, Easy Mounting
customer_reviews.text: This bike lock seems tough enough for me to feel safe leaving my bike around the city. Relatively straightforward to mount the bracket to attach The cable is long enough to connect the front and rear wheels of my bike. I imagine that this would deter all but the most serious and well-equipped bike thieves. The cable provides an extra level of security against an opportunist who is looking to grab one of your wheels, or in situations when you have to lock your bike to an unconventional object like a fence or railing. Another note, I keep my bike outside and ride often in inclement weather, and the lock has survived a year of snow, rain, sun, and dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Mike

customer_reviews.title: Secure u-lock that lasts
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bike lock I have ever bought. U-locks are a must if you are serious about locking up a bike. Kryptonite is an excellent brand to go with if you bike around a city and/or have any need to lock up a bike outside. I love that this comes with the extra rope lock, so you can thread the back tire into the rest of the lock to secure the entire bike. I've been using this lock for two years and I've never had a problem with it. I don't bike everyday, but I do frequently in the summers.
customer_reviews.author: bondakir

customer_reviews.title: Does what is is supposed to do.  Poor design.  Keyhole cover and mounting bracket are junk.
customer_reviews.text: The key cover is pointless and loosely attached so it just flops around constantly getting in the way when I try to unlock but rarely covering the keyhole when in transit. Rubber "washers" at ends of "U" portion fell of first time I opened the lock. I hate the metal bracket attachment on the "U". I never use a frame mount to carry so it is useless to me. Plus it bangs on my bike every time I pass the lock through the frame and wheels. The cable is fine.
customer_reviews.author: JB123

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for the u lock which has worked great. Definitely heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the u lock which has worked great. Definitely heavy duty, would need a hack saw or power tool to cut off and with the lock design seems tough to pick. Do wish it was all black. Locks my 1up bike rack to truck since no hitch pin and hangs down in all the road grime/winter salt and still works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: NOT item in picture and no cable included
customer_reviews.text: NOT the lock pictured and DOES NOT Include cable. This description is way off. Returned first time for wrong lock and missing cable. Replacement was identical. This is not the product pictured or described!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Standard Safety Bike Lock
customer_reviews.text: I feel like a nerd with the cord, but I've also had 2 bikes stolen already. So... So far so good! Perfect size for my DiamondBack mountain/commuter bike. I'm glad I didn't pick the smaller one, it would not have fit. I didn't use the included mounting kit though because my frame is too small, and the mount is bulky. Good lock, you get 2 keys which is nice, and the cord is nice too it's up to you if you use it or not. Everyone in town seems to have this lock, and it seems to work for most people. It's a good standard lock, maybe I'll get a more heavy duty one if this one somehow fails.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Forrester

customer_reviews.title: Installation is 11 steps
customer_reviews.text: I open the package, and out come all these pieces. 11 steps and over 2 columns of instructions on how to install. Really? I just want to enjoy riding my bike, not spend half an afternoon figuring out how to install this. Item may very well work well, but without the ability to install this, I cannot determine the item's efficiency. I regret buying this and should've done better research.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The lock works as it should. I brought the ...
customer_reviews.text: The lock works as it should. I brought the two (2) year insurance the company offered, as well as took their advice of removing the front wheel and locking it to the bike frame while looping the cable through the back tire. I know a lot of people might say that's a lot of work to lock your bike up, but if you've ever come out of a store to see your lock or cable laying on the ground and no bike, then yeah the extra couple of minutes seems well worth it to me. I also purchased a Joyluxy Goldiger Alarm Lock Anti-theft Motion Sensor lock as extra protection that I clip on to my rear disc.
customer_reviews.author: Keith H.

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: not too heavy, but seems like it has worked as a good deterrent in the nyc area for a 3+ years now. I still dont leave the bike out overnight or anything, but it definitely helps delay any crooks
customer_reviews.author: H. T.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for biking in the city
customer_reviews.text: Used to lock my bike up in Washington DC, and have not had an issue with theft. Usually my bike would be locked in public less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: R Mac

customer_reviews.title: Broken easily
customer_reviews.text: Like most of the bike locks I purchase I try breaking into it myself. Unfortunately this lock I was able to break within a few seconds of trying with bolt cutters. There are far better locks out there to spend your money on. I do not recommend this lock
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Great lock
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble mounting but that is probably user error. Great lock including both a u lock and cable option.
customer_reviews.author: JillyBeans

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 5 years now and it sits in the rain every winter. I oil it fairly often but it’s never gotten stuck. Will definitely be buying another if this one ever dies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This would be a great lock for a bike commuter who needs the extra ...
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great lock for a bike commuter who needs the extra security. I am a recreational rider, and it's very heavy and difficult (for me) to mount to my bike and keep it out of the way. For exercise riding I've just decided to roll the dice when I take breaks with the family rather than have to carry it with me. Again, would be great for someone who rides to work and really needs to secure their bike, or someone that doesn't necessarily have to carry it with them on the bike. Very solid lock
customer_reviews.author: WolfpackRaider

customer_reviews.title: Good lock.
customer_reviews.text: I'll start with its heavy but its a U-lock so why wouldn't it be. Its convenient to me because of the shape of my bike which doesn't allow me to place it anywhere on it. I do admit it does give max protection to my bike. The cable provided is thick and sturdy. I usually just carry the u-lock but in cases where i might take long I'll bring the cable along. I recommend it to anyone who use's their bike daily or occasionally. I recommend registering it with Kryptonite. It comes with 2 keys with the option of getting additional keys if lost.
customer_reviews.author: Yessenia

customer_reviews.title: Best Bike lock in the market
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy anything else. My bike is still with me and I use this everyday. I have tried the Giant surelock and also the chain lock, the metal and quality in this is amazing. It is sturdy and lived up by my expectations by far.
customer_reviews.author: amoh thali

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had a bike stolen since getting this lock!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome bike lock if you really DON'T want your bike to be stolen. It is big and cumbersome to carry it around on your bike, but the way it attaches to the frame makes it surprisingly convenient. I purchased this lock after having two bikes stolen while being locked up with some pretty heavy duty bike locks. I have not had a bike stolen since. The flexible chain is good for locking the front wheel up while the U-lock locks the frame and rear wheel to whatever you are locking your bike to.
customer_reviews.author: MBadon

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, sturdy, secure lock.
customer_reviews.text: My family made me buy a U Lock as there has been an increase in bike theft in the area. I thought that my thin chain was fine, but this heavy thing makes me feel much more secure. It comes with a thicker chain than the one I had, and a mounting system to mount the U Lock onto the body of your bike. (I have been using my bike basket to hold it instead.) Might be a little hard to fit around some bike frames, but overall I think it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: DamaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Key replacement!
customer_reviews.text: There's a lock registration on the website so you can order a replacement key if you need to for $10. This is the best feature ever! My keys were recently stolen and I was really nervous I wouldn't be able to get my bike unlocked because the lock is really secure and strong. I'm THRILLED with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Good lock for the average user
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a new bike and wanted a good lock to go with it, since I park it at the train station when I go to work. Depending on the level of security you need for your bike, you might need to get a really fat, heavy lock(s), but on average this lock does just fine. It is a little big and the way the mount fits I actually had some trouble trying to find a place to put it on my bike frame where it wouldn't hit my legs as I pedal, but I found ONE spot on my bike that works. So far so good with this lock.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality lock and the company is very reliable
customer_reviews.text: Super high quality lock and the company is very reliable. The cord is a nice thick cord but not heavy to carry around. The lock itself is easy to use and easy to carry around. The size is compact for a ulock, and the cord makes it easy to secure your bike no matter the lockup location.
customer_reviews.author: major_critic.deal_lover

customer_reviews.title: Good lock for the bike!
customer_reviews.text: I originally wrote a review that I thought the lock was heavier than anticipated but after doing my research this lock was rated one of the better in the market. I have since installed and used the lock and am satisfied with it. I do think it'll do the job of keeping my bike safe in the city and isn't as heavy once installed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura C Galvin

customer_reviews.title: ... (4-inch x 9-inch) with 4-Foot Flex Cable is a great simple lock for my bicycle
customer_reviews.text: this Kryptonite Kryptolok Series 2 Standard Bicycle U-Lock with Transit FlexFrame Bracket (4-inch x 9-inch) with 4-Foot Flex Cable is a great simple lock for my bicycle. I love the Transit FlexFrame Bracket because it allows me to not need to deal with putting the lock in my backpack when I go for a short ride to grab some food. I trust the U lock to protect my bicycle frame but then my wheels are exposed theft, so I use the 4 foot flex cable to lock down whichever we wheel I wasn't able to secure with the U-lock.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin2109

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job, but it is heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This does it's job, but it is heavy, and awkward to mount to my bike, especially with a water bottle cage on my vertical bar and on my lower straight bar. I ended up mounting this forward on my upper straight bar, at a slight cant to the right and it seems to stay out of my way. I am really happy that this kit came with the cable lock, I have found that finding something to attach the U bolt to is sometimes hard in the suburbs. My other gripe with this thing is that it is really hard to remove this from it's holster that is mounted on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Was great, now terrible
customer_reviews.text: Was great... until the lock holder on the bike failed. Then fine... until both keys decided to suddenly have a hard time opening it. Now it is terrible. You never know if it will open right away or take 10 minutes or never
customer_reviews.author: Edward Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Nope, not secure.
customer_reviews.text: No match for bike thieves in Oakland. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Solid lock, my bike isn't getting stolen.
customer_reviews.text: Rugged af. Though I had issues mounting it to my bike frame and releasing it from the holder easily, so I just keep it in my sling pack.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisClu39

customer_reviews.title: Great product for medium security.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, love the way I can carry it. Install was easy, but you will find the instructions to appear more difficult than it really is, as you will see so many information but it's actually really easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: tiko.col

customer_reviews.title: I still own the bike
customer_reviews.text: U-locks are u-locks. Safest, but cumbersome. I use it every day. Remember to register your bike!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Great Heavy Duty Bike lock and very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've used the bike lock every day for the past 3 weeks in the Greater Chicago Land area and it works great. I use the cable to loop through the back tire and bike frame and then loop into the U-Lock that is holding the bike rack and front tire. Works great and is very heavy duty. Be sure to save the instructions as you can get a free backup key if you lose your keys or misplace them. Just make sure to register an account with your key code (numbers on the keys). I don't use the mount, I feel it makes the bike look "junky" if there is too much stuff on the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bike Lock
customer_reviews.text: Objective: Sometimes I will take bike rides and need to do pit stops at places for a short time. I needed a locking system that I can quickly use to fasten the front wheel to the bike frame as well as fasten the bike to a post. Pros: This is heavy duty. U-lock is great for locking bike frame to a post, and wire is perfect for locking front tire to the bike frame. Cons: It's a bit heavy, but it comes with having good security, so that's okay.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Chang

customer_reviews.title: this mf hardcore !!
customer_reviews.text: I had a different bike lock (not a U, coil cable with combination lock) and some dude tried to break it open so I got this bad boy and no one has been messing with my bike and trying to steal it since. It sometimes takes a bit longer to situate and lock/unlock than my previous one with the easy code and I'm always scared I will lose the key but that's a chance I'm willing to take for no one to steal my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Great product with many uses. Lol
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy for me. I originally bought this for my moped and used it to lock my rear tire to a pole when parking it. Not I use it to lock my driveway gates together so solicitors, meth heads and my stalker ex girlfriend don't feel like they can trespass on my property despite my "No Tresspassing" and "Beware of Dog" signs. It wont keep my stalker or anybody else from climbing my fence and trespassing on my property but now I know that if someone knocks on my door that I need to get my gun before I answer it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a heavily populated area of NYC so a quality lock for my bike is what I was looking for. I bought this 4 years ago and still have my bike! Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: colin earyes

customer_reviews.title: Must have for College students!
customer_reviews.text: this lock SAVED my bike so many times. my friends on campus all part their bikes next to each other. luckily i was the only one that invested in a more expense lock, but let me tell you. this lock means serious business. in the span of 2 years i am the ONLY one with my bike still on the rack..not to mention i have a road bike compared to there regular bike. someone did slash my seat (i believe because they were angry they could not get my bike loose) the cord is long enough that it wraps around my front tires (that can be disconnected) and wrap around the pole onto the lock. MUST HAVE for college students!
customer_reviews.author: Jemal

customer_reviews.title: Well made bike lock at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality bike lock at a great price. Purchased this for my son headed off to college. Local bike shop had the same lock and was $20.00 more in price. This lock is well made and sturdy. Like how it has the U lock and also the cable to go through as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole L

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to - but a bit of a pain in the neck
customer_reviews.text: I must admit that it is a real pain in the neck to carry and use this lock. However, living in New York City makes it a necessity. The lock fully functions as intended. That being said, I find it difficult to locate the keyhole and insert the key, and remove and install the locking arm due to one end being curved. I also find the lock to be too short to get around my bicycle and different types of poles. All of that being said, there are not that many options for securing your bicycle in a place like New York, and this does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Secure bike lock!
customer_reviews.text: Felt so much safer after buying this lock. It's heavy and feels very secure. It comes with a loop rope that you can use for extra security to make sure you're protecting both wheels. Long lock that helps with bigger bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Lin

customer_reviews.title: Good lock, but what do I know?
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Well-designed (especially the attachment to the frame). Feels damn secure. Stays out of the way when I don't need it, locks nicely when I do. I have no idea what I'm supposed to do with the cable, how to store it conveniently, or why it's necessary. But I'll likely grab a Masterlock and keep it as a spare/quickie thing. The only reason I give it 4 stars is because I have no idea how well it will withstand an attempt to steal the bike. But hey, I ride a 63 cm frame. I'd like to see any of you normal-sized people try to steal my Giant Bike!
customer_reviews.author: Nova

customer_reviews.title: Broken frame mount on first outing. Over-tightening required to keep the lock from shifting.
customer_reviews.text: The locking mechanism is functioning, but the frame mounting device broke on it's first long ride. In order to keep the mount from slipping on the bike frame while riding, I tightened the mount screw very tight. After a few bumps the plastic mount cracked. The lock fell off my bike and I ran over it, nearly throwing me to the ground. The mount is made of a brittle material; this could have been avoiding with a washer installed in the mount. Oh well... I'll find something else.
customer_reviews.author: mwils

customer_reviews.title: Great in the beginning --> Unusable after about 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Locks well. Easy to lock with a guided system. Make sure to keep the bolt free of rust. I had another one of these a few years back and the bolt became so rusty that it got stuck and I wasn't able to unlock it for several hours. (Had to try over and over again with force until my fingers had blisters). I used this lock every day, so this was not due to not using the lock for months... UPDATE: The second lock is now also unusable after a little less than 2 years. Even though I made sure the locking mechanisms stayed free of rust and dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Marty

customer_reviews.title: Lock's securely.
customer_reviews.text: Solid lock system. May be a little big for quick commuting around town, but I knew my bike was safe. Has a tendency to rattle in the holster on my bike, just takes some extra effort to make sure everything is tight enough not to rattle.
customer_reviews.author: LegoJowns

customer_reviews.title: Can't return something that got stolen.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 2 of these so far on Amazon and sadly there was an attempt to steal my bike with the cable getting cut off and my bike got stolen because someone tried to eff with the U lock and I couldn't open it with the key and the bike ended up getting stolen :'[ I never thought a U lock would get broken into like that. It didn't work when I needed it to. Good size tho =/
customer_reviews.author: Ruhjeenuh

customer_reviews.title: Bike stolen in broad daylight in front of the police headquarter
customer_reviews.text: Bike stolen in Alameda while parked outside the library, in front of the police headquarter. So obviously it really didn't take long for the thieves to break the lock in board daylight. Very disappointed. Plus the holder to install on the bike was very difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Xun Huang

customer_reviews.title: It's a Kryptonite. It's solid. There's not much ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a Kryptonite. It's solid. There's not much to say here other than it's a big, bulky, solid lock that does exactly what it says on the tin. This goes in my backpack if I plan to be out for a little while
customer_reviews.author: Distantsoil

customer_reviews.title: Decent lock
customer_reviews.text: Decent lock. Haven't had any issues, but I don't lock up my bikes in a bad area. The mount system is nice, but I really couldn't find a spot to mount this on my bike. I wish there was a different way to mount it. Other than, I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great lock with terrible mounting bracket.
customer_reviews.text: The lock itself is perfect for my needs, but the mounting bracket is a true disappointment. I had to tighten the mounting screw on every ride, and it is absolutely annoying. In this price range this problem should to eliminated. Now i have to use an extra velcro strap to fix the wobble and keep the lock in the desired position.
customer_reviews.author: Dudkin

customer_reviews.title: Good, but Wobbly and Noisy
customer_reviews.text: I guess this is pretty good protection with the ability to lock your front wheel with the cable. My complaint is that it uses a nylon band to attach to your bike. This connection is adaptable to any frame, but it's wobbly, and the lock makes a lot of noise bouncing up and down on bumps. I wish they would come up with something that attaches solidly with metal and bolts. However, I'm not sure there is a good alternative currently on the market.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: u lock stuck on bracket, on first use.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even used this product yet, and i do not like it. As i was trying to use the bracket, and attach the lock to it, the bracket already broke, and now the u lock will not remove itself from the bracket piece that it slides on to. Haven't even used this yet, and i am already upset and frustrated. There is now way to contact anyone about help on this matter, so i thought if i mentioned it here maybe i would get some assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: Probably a great lock
customer_reviews.text: This thing is Crazy heavy, I mostly ride a Fat Bike and when you're trying every possible way to shave bike weight I'm not sure this is the way to go. I still have it because I feel like I'm going to need it(I do that sometimes)But I've yet to install it just because it's just so darn heavy. All that being said it's probably a really good lock, but if you search youtube you'll see that people can basically brake into every single lock on the market in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Bike stolen at first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for my mike and one for my wife's. The first day that I used this, my wife's bike got stolen from my secured parking garage. Unfortunately there are not security camera's to catch who did this. I used the cable though the frame and rear wheel too. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Awkward

customer_reviews.title: it feels like I have the wrong key (I don't)
customer_reviews.text: This lock has been the bane of my existence for months. I gave it more than one star because it technically works, but every single time I try to unlock it, it feels like I have the wrong key (I don't). This lock has trained me that if I fiddle with it just right, I can unlock it, but there have been many days where it has taken an absurd amount of time to get it loose, and I'm afraid that one day I'll lose my bike to this lock.
customer_reviews.author: PlusMinus

customer_reviews.title: More like 3. 5 because it does ease my mind ...
customer_reviews.text: More like 3.5 because it does ease my mind when I lock my bike up in a busy manhattan corner. But it gets a little tricky taking it off the holder and it sometimes gets in the way of the pedal, so adjustment is needed frequently. But for the purpose of anti-theft and it's price? I do not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very good protection. With the extra cable I am able to chain my wheel and my wife's bike to mine. You can mount this thing anywhere on your bike and orientate it any way you want. Although the best thing about the lock is the 1 year $1500 insurance policy, for $20 you can upgrade to 3 years. That is way cheaper than trying to go through any insurance agency that I have spoken to that wants monthly payments. This policy alone has eased my mind, because a determined person will get your bike eventually, but at least you won't be totally out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: Moped lock
customer_reviews.text: As an owner of a small moped I am not comfortable with the lock the wheel in a turned position method of getting it not stolen. Anyone can pick it up and put it in their van or truck. Probably a more appropriate size for a normal bike, but the guidelines are all online. For the U shaped part, I did have some trouble lining it up so I could actually twist the key. Not docking the stars because I figure that's user problems not product problems. Kryptonite also gives you paperwork to register you lock and insure your bike for pretty cheap, which is cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Cheap insurance
customer_reviews.text: Just got this a few days ago. If it withstands a serious theft attempt I'll bump it to five stars, but it sure looks like it would. The U locks up the frame and rear wheel, while the thick cable goes around a post, rack, or whatever plus through the front wheel. With most adult bikes going for upwards of $700 (mine was about $850), spending $38 bucks on a one time insurance policy seems like a good idea. For what it's worth, a similar cable and a Master lock thwarted an attempt on my daughter's relatively inexpensive school commute bike. The one I'm reviewing I bought for myself, but I'm getting another for her.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nutter

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted but it will do
customer_reviews.text: The mount is not very well made and the key gets jammed in the lock almost every time, I have used it 3 times and has happened every time. Update: I have been using this lock for a month now and every time I try to unlock or lock it the key gets jammed. It is very annoying to have to constantly hassle with the lock. Also there is a guard inconveniently places that slides over the key hole, it does not line up properly and gets in the way. Not sure what it is for but I am unhappy with this lock. Should of went with with an Onguard.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Not Perfect, But Surely Substantial...
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a sturdy product, but to be perfectly honest--- after seeing potential flaws with the design--- I'm not too stoked about the "bent foot" design on one end of the shackle, as compared to the double-bolt feature most other high-quality U-locks have; despite that, the primary reason I purchased a pair of these was because of the overall ratings & customer reviews, which made it seem quite popular nonetheless... (But then again, I always use a multi-lock system to secure my bikes anyway, so... Y'know. Whatever.) Anything to make a low-life scumbag's work even more daunting... >=)
customer_reviews.author: Saph-Fire

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I want, though carrying around the cable is annoying.
customer_reviews.text: Kryptonite was nice enough to provide a mounting clasp that fits on the crossbar (in three different directions) for the U-lock, which means that riding around with it is easy and painless. However, no similar mounting exists for the cable which means for now I've been keeping it rolled up around my handlebar, which is annoying and pesky. However, this is obviously good construction and the U-lock is big enough to fit through my back wheel, frame, and whatever I'm locking it to. I'm pretty happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and durable for life.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second kryptonite bike lock (I now have two bikes) and they seem to have improved access to the keyhole as well as the mount to your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Jaggard

customer_reviews.title: Feel confident locking up bike with Kryptonite
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my lock/cable for about a year now. Once I lock my bike to a bike rack, it isn't going anywhere. But living in an urban environment, I don't leave my bike out at night, just for shopping around town. Occasionally I've overloaded my bike bag and have carried the lock and cable slung over my shoulder. It works pretty well that way.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeview

customer_reviews.title: Solid security for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother in NYC and he never paid me. I personally have this lock (not the cable, just the U-lock) and it's solid. After some research, if felt like the best bang for the buck as far as basic bike security goes for NYC. Your bike could still get jacked, but this will slow them down.
customer_reviews.author: Logan M. Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Very secure lock
customer_reviews.text: In my years of bike ownership I have always trusted the Kryptonite brand. This is a serious lock and the addition of the cable makes me feel secure locking up in not so great neighborhoods. I can get the cabe through both wheels and easily lock to a bike rack securely. I have no doubt when I lock up using this. I also love that you can register with the company for free just in case something happens with your keys (2 come with it but things happen) and they will replace the key quickly and for free. Excellent value for the price. If you care about your bike this is the lock to go with.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Great lock, uncuttable Would recommend buying after seeing a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great lock, uncuttable Would recommend buying after seeing a thief tried stealing my bike by trying to cut the wires part but wasn't even to be able to get through it. He didn't even notice to ulock portion. Consider that this lock is at a right price it is worth it to protect any bike easily over 700 dollars
customer_reviews.author: Secret Customer

customer_reviews.title: but then it's not their best line of products
customer_reviews.text: It's alright for what it does. It just hints of extra protection to encourage the prospective bike thieves to keep looking. A bit ungainly with a cumbersome design, but then it's not their best line of products. You get what you pay for I guess. Happy enough for now, will probably get a better lock at some point in the future. Nothing against the brand though.
customer_reviews.author: Anirban Samanta

customer_reviews.title: Lock mechanism constantly fails
customer_reviews.text: Lately I've been using my bike more frquently and every time I try to open/close the lock, it gets stuck and fails to work. I have to constantly spend a good couple minutes every single time just to secure my bike. It's been so frustrating that sometimes I just leave my bike unlocked to avoid having to deal with this lock.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Great Lock, Great Cable - Bracket?  Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this purchase - Love the lock (used Kryptonite locks before). The Cable is as strong as you would expect. But the bracket is worthless to me. I usually have no trouble building or attaching anything...but I gave up on this. There was no good way to mount this bracket on my Trek bike so the lock is removeable and still have room for a bottled water. I wish I could have the lock with me all the time, but I can't. So .. I carry the lock/cable in a lightweight backpack when I know I need it - and leave the lock/cable at home when I don't.
customer_reviews.author: FW

customer_reviews.title: Had to send this back. Something wrong with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to send this back. Something wrong with the tumblers. Took 15 minutes to get it to open, then couldn't get it to close. Maybe wrong key set was tied to it. I've got lots of Kryptonite locks and have never had a problem except for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is great
customer_reviews.text: Basically I bought this for my new bike, when I got it I realized it was a little too hard core for just my bike, I would totally recommend this for a motorcycle though. I misunderstood or expected more of a bike lock- this is totally my fault. Customer service was great and let me return it with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Joana

product_meta.title: Kryptonite KryptoLok Series 2 Standard Heavy Duty Bicycle U Lock with 4ft Flex Bike Cable
product_meta.description: Replaced with new and improved design in 2017 - check out our New U lock, it will send any bike thief running!. 13mm hardened MAX-PERFORMANCE STEEL SHACKLE resists cutting and leverage attacks. Includes 4’ KRYPTOFLEX™ DOUBLE LOOP CABLE for securing front wheel or accessories. Reinforced HARDENED CROSS BAR DESIGN provides increased protection. HIGH SECURITY DISC-STYLE CYLINDER. Center keyway defends against leverage attacks. ANTI-RATTLE BUMPERS reduce noise during transport. Rotating dustcover protects cylinder. Includes NEW TRANSIT FLEXFRAME-U transportation system which allows for versatile carrying.Protective vinyl coating.2 STAINLESS STEEL KEYS. Key Safe Program.
feature_bullets: Replaced with new and improved design in 2017 - check out our New U lock, it will send any bike thief running!
13mm hardened MAX-PERFORMANCE STEEL SHACKLE resists cutting and leverage attacks
Includes 4’ KRYPTOFLEX DOUBLE LOOP CABLE for securing front wheel or accessories
Reinforced HARDENED CROSS BAR DESIGN provides increased protection
Center keyway defends against leverage attacks
ANTI-RATTLE BUMPERS reduce noise during transport
Includes NEW TRANSIT FLEXFRAME-U transportation system which allows for versatile carrying

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
